result.execSummary:
The defendant John Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Robinson was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Robinson

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

04:15 PM Defendant John Robinson in Court with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant John Robinson in custody.  ADA Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes Sentencing on Revocation on 21CF172 and Status on 22CF49.  Atty. Nelson presents Court with Plea Questionnaire for 22CF49.  ADA Schieffer recites agreement.  State requests Court follow recommendations of DOC on 21CF172.  130 days credit not including today.  On 22CF49 Defendant pleading to Count Three, State moving to dismiss Counts One, Two, and Four.  90 days in Jail w/credit for 60 days not including today.  Entitled to good time, concurrent to 21CF172.  $518 court costs.  Court questions restitution.  ADA Schieffer advises none and State is in compliance with Victim's rights.  Atty. Nelson and Defendant agree with recitation.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form filed with the Court reviewed with Defendant.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count Three of 22CF49.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court finds Def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the Plea.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count Three and enters conviction.  Counts One, Two and Four are dismissed.  ADA Schieffer states position; requests 12 months on 21CF172.  Atty. Nelson states position; requests 7 months on 21CF172, noting more availabilty for treatment in MN.  Defendant makes statement.  Court addresses Defendant and notes consideration.  Court sentences Defendant.
-On 21CF172,   
- 12 months Jail.  130 days credit.  Entitled to good time.
-$518 converted to civil judgment.  
Court would allow sentenced to be served in another county and/or Minnesota if at no cost to Pierce County. 
On 22CF49 Count Three, 
-90 days Jail, concurrent to 21CF172.  60 days credit.  Entitled to good time.  
-$518 court costs converted to civil judgment.
DNA sample.  
Appeal rights are given to the Defendant.  Adjourned at 4:48 PM
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

2:02 PM Defendant John Robinson apppears from Jail in person, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson states he has a SEHR and would like this follow. Attorneys to set with the JA. Court adjourned at 2:04 pm.
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif
Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. Court confirms address and phone number. NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court adjourned at 2:46 pm.

2:30 PM Defendant John Robinson appears in custody from Jail in person, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Kale Huppert. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions DE. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. ADA Schieffer is requesting the Court find probable cause and binb DE over.  The Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds DE over for further proceedings. ADA Schieffer is requesting 22TR420 be dismissed. Court dismisses 22TR420.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
filed by Atty Nelson

3:02 PM Defendant John Robinson appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Derek W Sanders appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF49 and 22TR420.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NTO and NC D.M.L., no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number. On 22TR420 DE enters a NG and to trail 22CF49.  Court adjourned at 3:14 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
